alert.note: Alert for Chambers; Lee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 8:21PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lee and southwestern Chambers Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 821 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waverly, or near Camp Hill, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Opelika, Waverly, Oak Bowery, Auburn University, Loachapoka, Robert G. Pitts Airport, Chewacla State Park, Roxana and Mount Jefferson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
